text: Hi all, just a quick update for you that we've added an icon picker field in the new design manager. This field will allow your content creators to pick from a dropdown list of font awesome icons when they're building out web pages, making it much easier to swap out icons than it was previously. For more information, check out this blog post <https://designers.HubSpot.com/blog/now-live-icon-fields-added-to-the-new-design-manager>
What version of Font awesome is this?
We are using v5 on our sites That would be amazeballs
does it stay up to date with new stuff?
This is awesome. Was going to ask the same question above. Nice work!
I know I’m getting technical but it does matter - which implementation, javascript or web font? or do we as developers pick how we output it?

Also because the marketers are going to ask you for this - any plans to allow marketers to upload custom icons to be picked from the picker?(just opening that can of worms now because fair warning it’s going to get asked)
sorry for the 20 questions, but 1 more - any plans to support the paid version or does it support the paid(pro) versions

Wondering how that would work <@U7SL518D6>... Would it append the icon to the font awesome library for their portal? Load it on the side with/ after FA ? Just your first thoughts, obviously it's a HS dev question at heart

<@U4RP6AGV9> I would think FA would be loaded either as a HS hosted file, or as a CDN’d file from fontawesome directly.

Custom icons would have to be specified in svg format and it would add a separate css or js file for those items. If HS can find a way to make it performant they could  combine the two files together on their end though probably not ideal for them.

All good questions….

1. It does not automagically update. As of today that is something we will be manually doing though we are exploring a more scaleable solution. 
2. We are exploring what it might look like to allow users to combine icon sets. As of today I do not have an ETA on that. 
3. No plans as of today to support a paid version though we are exploring a much larger play that touches on integrating paid versions of many “things” into the system
_“exploring a much larger play that touches on integrating paid version of many ‘things’ into the system”_ let the conspiracy theories and crazy speculation begin! :tada:
What does the output of this field look like? Does it output the whole icon element, does it give you the class name, or what?
*waiting for <@U22PNRAJD> to throw in a cheeky “well why don’t you give it a shot, it’s live!” remark*
It'd just be handy if there was a reference for that sort of thing somewhere, so I don't have to experiment every time :stuck_out_tongue:
<!-- insert comment about open source documentation here -->
No argument from me on that
by default it outputs SVGs. There’s a tag you can use that allows you to select SVG or CSS. When you use CSS, it will include the webfont for you automatically
that’s perfect! glad you guys thought about that
it outputs an SVG by default
we aim to please :slightly_smiling_face:
Yeah. We have the paid version of FA and love it.
Like the CDN js? or just an SVG icon
Currently I use the JS and do a form a tree shaking to only output the icons that I am using

Anyone have any insight about this error in Zapier or see other issues using it lately? Looks like there might be issues on HubSpot's side?
"We had trouble sending your test through. Please try again. Error: <http://api.hubapi.com|api.hubapi.com> returned (400) Bad Request and said nothing"
inline SVG
<@U26C29XPH> what are you trying to do. I’ve seen this error when timeouts happen and also when there is an error in data retrieval
Sync a contact from Chargebee to HubSpot is all <@U25C65C3S>
